text:
Hi, I have been trying to print a SVG rectangle using the PCL renderer.  I am
using ver. 1.13 of the PCL renderer because I use tables on my page as well. The
code that I am using look like:
--------------------------part of code------------------------
<fo:block>
 <fo:instream-foreign-object>
   <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="20" height="20">
     <g>
        <rect x="0" y="0" width="15" height="15" style="stroke:none;"/>
     </g>
   </svg>
 </fo:instream-foreign-object>
</fo:block>
----------------------------------------------------------
Does ver 1.13 of the PCL renderer not support SVG or am I doing something wrong?
Please help me, I have been trying to figure this out for a while now.  Thanks,
- if you have any questions feel free to email me: amitr@hemtech.co.za
creator: amitr@hemtech.co.za

text:
The current PCLRenderer does not support SVG. When Batik was added to FOP for 
SVG support, the PCLRenderer was not updated to support this. Enhancing the 
PCLRenderer to support SVG will be a non-trivial undertaking as Batik has no 
PCL support (last I knew). To fix this PCL support would need to be added to 
Batik then the PCLRenderer would need to be modified to use the new Batik PCL 
functionality.

Probably the only (easy) options at the moment are to use an old (pre-Batik) 
version of FOP or convert the SVGs to bitmap images and include them that way.
creator: art_w@eastpoint.com

text: *** Bug 14417 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: oleg@tkachenko.com
jeremias@apache.org
text: Current versions of Apache FOP support SVG for PCL output.
batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
creator: gadams@apache.org
